intro: Cyphia eckloniana, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange-red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are clustered in terminal panicles. Cyphia eckloniana is well adapted to coastal environments and thrives in full sun.
